metadata.title: tinycrab - Spawn AI Agents in Seconds
metadata.description: The fastest way to get an AI agent running. SDK, CLI, and HTTP API for rapid prototyping.

hero.title: Spawn AI Agents
hero.description: The fastest way to get an AI agent running. One line of code, instant agent.

spawn.title: Watch them spawn
spawn.description: Each crab is an independent agent with its own workspace, memory, and tools.

why.title: Built for Speed
why.description: You're building something that involves AI agents. You need one running now.
why.conclusion: You don't need the most powerful agent. You need an AI agent running right now.

features.title: What You Get
features.description: Everything you need, nothing you don't.

coding.title: Full coding capabilities
coding.description: bash, read, write, edit, grep, find

workspace.title: Isolated workspaces
workspace.description: Each agent has its own directory

scheduling.title: Autonomous scheduling
scheduling.description: Agents schedule future actions, wake up, act

selfSpawn.title: Self-spawning
selfSpawn.description: Agents can spawn new agents via bash

ways.title: Three Ways to Spawn
ways.description: Choose your interface. Same agent underneath.

deploy.title: Works Everywhere
deploy.description: Same code, same behavior. Test locally, deploy anywhere.

cta.future: Coming soon: Agent Swarm - coordinate multiple agents working together

footer.builtFor: Built for developers who move fast.

agents.title: For AI Agents
agents.description: Need to spawn a worker agent? tinycrab gets you an AI agent running in seconds.
agents.sessionDesc: Save session_id from responses to continue conversations

index.title: Documentation
index.description: Everything you need to know about tinycrab.

quickstart.title: Quickstart
quickstart.description: Get tinycrab running in under 5 minutes.

deploy.title: Deployment
deploy.description: Deploy to Docker, Railway, Fly.io, or Render.

quickstart.title: Quickstart
quickstart.description: Get tinycrab running in under 5 minutes.
quickstart.prereq2: An API key from OpenAI, Anthropic, or another supported provider

sdk.title: SDK Reference
sdk.description: Use tinycrab programmatically in your TypeScript/JavaScript projects.

cli.title: CLI Reference
cli.description: Complete guide to the tinycrab command-line interface.
cli.spawnDesc: Create and start a new agent.
cli.chatDesc: Send a message to an agent.
cli.cleanupDesc: Stop agent and delete all files.
cli.httpDesc: Each spawned agent runs an HTTP server. You can communicate with it directly:

api.title: HTTP API
api.description: REST API endpoints for interacting with agents.
api.postChatDesc: Send a message to the agent.
api.getHealthDesc: Check if the agent is running.
api.getSessionsDesc: List all sessions for this agent.

deploy.title: Deployment
deploy.description: Deploy tinycrab to Docker, Railway, Fly.io, or Render.
deploy.railwayDesc: Deploy to Railway using the GHCR image:

railwaySteps.step1: Create a new project on Railway

renderSteps.step2: Select "Deploy an existing image from a registry"

deploy.usageDesc: Once deployed, communicate with your agent via HTTP:
